articles.author: DANICA KIRKA and BRIAN MELLEY
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — A British judge has sentenced Lucy Letby to spend the rest of her life in prison for murdering seven babies and attempting to kill six others while working as a neonatal nurse at a hospital in northern England.
articles.title: British nurse Lucy Letby imprisoned for life for the murders of 7 babies and attempted murders of 6

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER WEBER, DAMIAN DOVARGANES and JORDI LEBRIJA
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Tropical Storm Hilary deluged arid parts of Mexico and then drenched Southern California from the coast to the desert resort city of Palm Springs and inland mountains, forcing rescuers to pull several people from swollen rivers.
articles.title: Southern California prepares for more floods as post-Tropical Storm Hilary brings more rain

articles.author: DANICA KIRKA and BRIAN MELLEY
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — A British judge has sentenced Lucy Letby to spend the rest of her life in prison for murdering seven babies and attempting to kill six others while working as a neonatal nurse at a hospital in northern England.
articles.title: British nurse Lucy Letby imprisoned for life for the murders of 7 babies and attempted murders of 6

articles.author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN, JULIE WATSON and ANDREW SELSKY
articles.description: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) — Freddy Tomas was working in his yard in Lahaina when the fire advanced with stunning speed right up to his fence. He rushed to save valuables from a safe inside his house but realized he didn't have time and fled, his face blackened with soot.
articles.title: Immigrant workers’ lives, livelihoods and documents in limbo after the Hawaii fire

articles.author: NICHOLAS RICCARDI and DAVID KLEPPER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A federal indictment and one in Georgia charging Donald Trump with lying about the 2020 election to overturn President Joe Biden’s win have done nothing to slow the geyser of election falsehoods flowing from the former president and his supporters.
articles.title: Trump and his allies double down on election lies after indictments for trying to undo 2020 results

articles.author: ANIRUDDHA GHOSAL and EVELYNE MUSAMBI
articles.description: Francis Ndege isn’t sure if his customers in Africa’s largest slum can afford to keep buying rice from him.Prices for rice grown in Kenya soared a while ago because of higher fertilizer prices and a yearslong drought in the Horn of Africa that has reduced production.
articles.title: Global food security is at crossroads as rice shortages and surging prices hit the most vulnerable

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA and JAE C. HONG
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Life in the capital of a war-torn country seems normal on the surface. In the mornings, people rush to their work holding cups of coffee. Streets are filled with cars, and in the evenings restaurants are packed.
articles.title: AP PHOTOS: Hiding beneath normality, daily life in Kyiv conceals the burdens of war

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL and EVELYNE MUSAMBI
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Border guards in Saudi Arabia have fired machine guns and launched mortars at Ethiopians trying to cross into the kingdom from Yemen, likely killing hundreds of the unarmed migrants in recent years, Human Rights Watch said in a report released Monday.
articles.title: Rights group says Saudi Arabian border guards fired on and killed hundreds of Ethiopian migrants

articles.author: REGINA GARCIA CANO
articles.description: GUAYAQUIL, Ecuador (AP) — Ecuadorian voters looking for a new leader to help curb the country’s unprecedented violence will have to head to the polls again in October for a runoff that is likely to see the ally of a convicted former president vie against the principal heir of a banana growing and exporting empire.
articles.title: A presidential runoff is likely in Ecuador between an ally of ex-president and a banana tycoon’s son

articles.author: TOM KRISHER
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — Just five years ago, a price-conscious auto shopper in the United States could choose from among a dozen new small cars selling for under $20,000. Now, there’s just one: The Mitsubishi Mirage.
articles.title: Looking for a new car under $20,000? Good luck. Your choice has dwindled to just one vehicle
